shortlist.name: Mukhtalif (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placed efforts, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered by Cieren Fallon, both with strong strike rates. Current odds reflect market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for victory.

shortlist.name: Pride Of Donegal (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid form with a recent fourth after a break, showing competitiveness at this level. Charlie Johnstonâ€™s runners often improve for a recent run, and Oisin Orr is a capable jockey. Odds offer value for a horse likely to be in the mix if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Rubellite (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Rubellite arrives in top form, having won last time out and consistently placing or winning in recent starts. The Fahey/Orr combination is reliable, and the odds reflect strong confidence. No signs of decline in form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Fleur De Mer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.2 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Fleur De Mer has been running consistently well in competitive handicaps, regularly finishing in the frame. The current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven recent form and no major negatives.

shortlist.name: Universal Story (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.06, SBK 11/4 (strong market support, clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, regularly finishing close up. Jockey Mulrennan is reliable at Newcastle and the odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections have placed the horse well and the form suggests readiness to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Girl Of Gold (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement, with a close fifth last time out in a stronger race. Fallon is a top jockey and the trainer is in good form. The odds reflect genuine winning chance and the horse is well placed to progress further.

shortlist.name: Stand Strong
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 3.9, SBK 7/4 (third market pick, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and a solid fourth last time indicate current form. McDonald is a strong jockey booking and Whillans has a good record with similar types. The horse is proven at the track and distance, and the odds offer fair value.

shortlist.name: Tiger Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last start, indicating peak form. Trained by Andrew Balding and ridden by P. J. McDonald, both highly respected at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and recent winning form is a major positive.

shortlist.name: Malachy's Wish
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out after a promising debut. Improving profile and represents value as the clear second pick in the market. Connections are capable and the form is progressive.

shortlist.name: Miakoda (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two seconds in last six starts, suggesting reliability and current well-being. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate confidence from connections and punters. No signs of regression in form cycle.

shortlist.name: Call Me Betty (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and multiple placings in recent starts. Consistently competitive at this level and holds solid form. Trainer and jockey are both reliable at this venue. Market support confirms expectations of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Coramento
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support; 11/5 SBK, 3.15 exchange (clear favourite).
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last eight starts. Reliable connections and proven ability at this level. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value for a horse with solid form.

shortlist.name: Oselton
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last start) and has shown improvement in form. Jockey is experienced and trainer has a good record at this venue. Odds reflect strong market support and recent winning form.

shortlist.name: Ring Of Gold
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings suggest reliability. Connections are respected and the horse has proven ability at this class. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with winning form and consistency.

shortlist.name: Parish Councillor (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with a recent win and consistent improvement. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate confidence. Connections are in good form and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Coloane (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with a recent win and another placed effort last time. Trainer is reliable at this venue and the odds reflect genuine winning chance. No signs of decline in recent form.

shortlist.name: Urban Dandy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent with multiple seconds and a win in recent starts. Jockey is experienced and the horse has shown ability to compete at this level. Odds suggest market respect and connections are capable.

shortlist.name: Carolus Magnus (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running in competitive handicaps and holding form at this level. Recent efforts suggest reliability and ability to run to a mark. Connections are respected at this venue. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value relative to rivals.

shortlist.name: Asadjumeirah
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (favoured in the market, clear contender)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and consistent form in similar company. Trainer and jockey have a good record with this type. Market position as favourite/near-favourite is justified by recent performances and reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Del Maro (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a 2nd and 3rd in competitive maidens, representing top connections. Buick and Appleby have a high strike rate at Newmarket, and the horse is well found in the market, indicating strong confidence. No signs of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Maltese Cross (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Debut second for Haggas/Marquand, both highly respected at this venue. The horse showed promise and is expected to improve naturally on second start. Market support is strong, and connections are reliable for placing horses to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Monoceros
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and followed up with a solid third in a stronger race. Trained by Charlie Appleby and ridden by William Buick, both highly successful at Newmarket. The form is progressive and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of regression and connections are in top form.

shortlist.name: Dark Shore
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, suggesting reliability and readiness. The horse is knocking on the door for a win and has shown ability at this level. Market support is solid and the form is genuine, with no need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Royal Velvet
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form in competitive handicaps; top jockey booking in William Buick adds confidence. Trainer has a solid record at this course. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Lady Roxby
shortlist.rationale: Placed in 3 of last 4 starts, including a win two runs back. Consistent at this level and proven over course and distance. Jockey/trainer combination has delivered in similar races. Odds offer fair value for a reliable contender.

shortlist.name: Arabian Leopard
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple placings and a win in recent starts. Trainer David Simcock is respected for placing horses well at Newmarket. Current odds are competitive for a horse with strong place credentials and potential to win.

shortlist.name: Distant Storm
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner and placed in a higher grade last time; top connections with Buick and Appleby; current odds reflect strong market confidence and form is progressive.

shortlist.name: Catullus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with steady improvement culminating in a win last time; same top stable as the favourite; odds offer value for a runner with proven form and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Palladium (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, trained by top connections, and currently trading as clear market leader. No signs of decline and fitness is assured by recent runs.

shortlist.name: Live Your Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid historical form, proven ability at this level, and returns after a break for a top yard with a leading jockey. Market support suggests readiness and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Shrimp Shady
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place in last three starts, now third-up and likely to be peaking. Top jockey/trainer combination adds confidence. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic chance.

shortlist.name: Burj Zabeel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 11/2 SBK, 4.7 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, recent form includes a win and several solid efforts. Trainer excels with similar types and jockey is in good form. Odds offer fair value for a reliable contender.

shortlist.name: Just Typical
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.1 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, including a win two starts ago and a solid second last time. Proven ability to win in current grade, and the booking of Billy Loughnane is a positive. Odds reflect strong market confidence and current form cycle is robust, with no sign of regression.

shortlist.name: Criminal Shore (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with several recent placings and a win earlier in the season. Oisin Murphy is a top jockey booking, and the horse has been holding form well in competitive handicaps. Market position suggests strong support and connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Gorgeous Mr George (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 8 exchange (solidly in the market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Has won twice in last five starts and placed last time, indicating reliable current form. Versatile and proven at this level, with a profile suggesting further improvement is possible. Odds are competitive and reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Kenisa Sport (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with back-to-back wins, top Irish connections, and leading jockey. Recent form is rock-solid and odds reflect clear market confidence. No signs of regression and should be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: King Roly
shortlist.rationale: King Roly has been running consistently well, with a recent win and two placed efforts in his last four starts. The latest form figures show he is holding his form and not on the decline. The Bowen team is in good order, and James Bowen is a strong jockey booking. Odds are fair for a horse with proven recent ability and reliable connections.

shortlist.name: Lightkeeper (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightkeeper arrives in peak form, having improved steadily with a win and a place in his last two starts. Gordon Elliott is a top trainer, and Sean Bowen is a notable jockey booking. The horse's profile suggests he is on the upgrade, and the market respects his chances. Connections and recent upward trajectory make him a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Inox Allen (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Inox Allen has a profile of winning fresh and has scored after a break before. The Lucinda Russell & Michael Scudamore partnership is highly capable, and the horse's form figures show a win on last completed start. Market support is strong, and the horse does not require major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Top Flight Century (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and several placed efforts this season. Shortest odds in the field, indicating strong market confidence. Connections are in form and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Burning It Up (Ire)

shortlist.name: Upfordebate (Ire)

shortlist.name: Cosmic Blizzard (Ire)

shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places in recent form. Top jockey and trainer partnership. Form figures show reliability and ability to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Idem (Fr)

shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 3.6 exchange (joint second favourite, well backed)

shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.15 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)

shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)

shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 7 exchange (market respect, not a longshot)

shortlist.name: Papa Don't Preach (Ire)

shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite at 2/1 (3.3 exchange), clear of the rest.

shortlist.odds_note: Solid value at 15/4 (SBK), 4.7 (exchange); among market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence. No signs of decline in form and odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Demetrius
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins and a third last time out show sustained peak form. Trainer excels with progressive types and the horse has proven ability at this level. Odds indicate strong support and form is reliable.

shortlist.name: Runamara (Ire)

shortlist.name: Gaspacho

shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 9/2 (exchange 5.2), clear of outsiders.

shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.15 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)

shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.7 exchange (solid second choice in market)

shortlist.name: Raulin (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in top form with back-to-back wins and a string of consistent efforts. Trainer and jockey are a proven combination. Recent improvement is genuine and the horse is holding form well, suggesting further progress is possible.

shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a solid record in competitive races. Recent fourth suggests fitness and reliability. Connections are capable, and odds are fair for a horse with proven ability.

shortlist.rationale: Has won two of last three starts, showing a return to form after a mid-season dip. Consistency and recent wins suggest the horse is thriving at present. Market support is strong, and connections are capable.

shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes and a win four starts back. Proven reliability at this level, holding form well and not showing signs of regression. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: In The Ether (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and a solid fourth last time suggest current competitiveness. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally. Odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet.
